meanings.definition: A molecule consisting of 60 carbon atoms arranged in a hollow sphere.
meanings.sent1: The scientists studied the buckminsterfullerene under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Many researchers are fascinated by the unique structure of buckminsterfullerene.
meanings.sent3: When the buckminsterfullerene molecule walked into the party, all the other molecules were amazed.
meanings.sent4: The buckminsterfullerene stood out in the crowd of carbon structures like a shiny gem.
meanings.sent5: The buckminsterfullerene's spherical shape makes it stand apart from other carbon compounds.

meanings.definition: The third allotrope of carbon, after graphite and diamond.
meanings.sent1: Have you learned about buckminsterfullerene in your science class yet?
meanings.sent2: Buckminsterfullerene is an interesting topic in the study of carbon chemistry.
meanings.sent3: The buckminsterfullerene and its carbon friends had a party to celebrate their differences.
meanings.sent4: In the world of carbon, buckminsterfullerene shines like a star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of buckminsterfullerene opened up new possibilities in material science.
